task.title: Wedges
task.shortdesc: You can create three-dimensional wedges consisting of five surface planes. The base of the wedge is always parallel with the xy plane of the current UCS with the sloped face opposite the first corner. The height is always parallel to the z-axis. You position the wedge by specifying either a corner or the center of the wedge. You determine the size of the wedge by either specifying a second corner and the height; defining the wedge based on a cube having a given length; or specifying the length, width, and height.

step.cmd: Choose Draw > Solids > Wedge from the mainmenu.
Specify the first corner of the base.
Specify the opposite corner of the base.

result.p: First corner of the base (A), the opposite corner of the base (B), and the height (C)
To create a wedge as a three-dimensionalsurface

ol.li: Choose Draw > Surfaces > 3D Surfaces from the mainmenu.
On the command line, type W (Wedge).
Specify the first corner of the base.
Specify the opposite corner of the base.
